revision.comment: /* top */ clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|flash1type = eMMC |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Kingston;EMMC04G-M627; |flash1size = 4 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = DDR3L |ram1type1 = SDRAM |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TC2G63GFR-PBA; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Atheros;AR8035-A; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:1F:7B |oui = 00:1F:7B

|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = USB 3.0 (Type C)
|serial = yes,, console port,, USB Female Micro-B,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Bluetooth 4.0, FM radio, Camera 5MP, LCD Display, temperature sensor, pressure sensor, buzzer |addchip = USB to Serial UART Chip;FTDI;FT232R;;1;,,, Low Power Stereo Codec;NXP;SGTL5000;;1;,,, 7 Channel Touch Sensor IC;Atmel;AT42QT1070;;1;,,, 16x8 LED Controller Driver;Holtek;HT16K33;;1;,,, 32Kb I2C Serial EEPROM;ON Semi;CAT24C32;;1;,,, Programmable-Delay Supervisory Circuit;TI;TPS3808;;1;,,, 3A Synchronous Buck Regulator;Alpha & Omegs;AOZ1021;;1;,,, 150mA Low-Dropout Regulator;Texas Instruments;TPS717;;3;,,, Single Channel USB Power Switch;Texas Instruments;TPS2065;;1;,,, 1-Bit Bidirectional Level-Shifting Voltage-Level Translator;TI;TXS0101;;2;,,, 8-Bit Bidirectional Level-Shifting Voltage Translator;TI;TXS0108E;;3;,,, 1A Power-Distribution Switch;Texas Instruments;TPS2061;;1;,,, 4-Bit Bidirectional Voltage-Level Translator;TI;TXS0104E;;1;,,, 2-Bit Bidirectional Voltage-Level Translator;TI;TXS0102;;2;,,, PWM Boost DC Controller;Fitipower Integrated;FP6791C;;1;,,, 40V White LED Driver;Fitipower Integrated;FP6745;;1;,,, 4A, 2MHz Step-Down Converter;Richtek;RT8070;;2;,,, Dual Bus Buffer Gate;TI;SN74LVC2G126;;1;,,, PMIC;NXP;MC32PF3000;;1;,,, |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 03/2018 |estprice = 200 |upc = 842776105363 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = AMPAK AP6335 |rad1modif = SDIO 3.0 |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4339; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |rad1ac = 433 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 800, 900, 1000, --> |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== {{See also|Google AIY Vision Kit}}
The kit includes: :• [[NXP]] i.MX7D Pico Development board :• ''Pimoroni'' Rainbow Hat :• 5MP Camera Module :• 5" Multi-touch Display :• Wi-Fi antenna :• Supporting cables
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Freescale (NXP)]]'' i.MX7D (MCIMX7D7DVM10SC) [[ARM]] :@800MHz Dual Core (Cortex-A7)/@200MHz (Cortex-M4) *Memory: 512MB SDRAM (DDR3L) *Onboard Storage: 4GB (eMMC) *Wi-Fi: 802.11abgn/ac 1T1R *Network: 1x Gigabit Ethernet *USB: 1x USB 2.0 port *Power Source: 5V (USB-C)
==Links of Interest== *[https://developer.android.com/things/hardware/imx7d?authuser=2&hl=ru&skip_cache=true User Guide] *[https://maker.pro/android/projects/android-things-developer-starter-kit-build ''The Android Things Developer Starter Kit Assembly'' on '''Maker Pro''']
